original_report:
microscopie: There are multiple mucosal fragments largely consisting of gastric-type mucosa with varying degrees of intestinal metaplasia and partly lined with squamous epithelium. There is mild chronic inflammation with varying degrees of stromal and epithelial reactive changes. There is a notably abnormal architecture, partly pronounced by tangential sectioning. A papillomatous aspect and lumina with serrated, micropapillary, and cribriform-appearing epithelial arrangement are observed. The lining epithelium shows slightly enlarged, irregularly shaped nuclei with some stacking. The cytoplasm varies from basophilic to eosinophilic. Differential diagnosis considers regenerative epithelial reaction and neoplastic proliferation.

conclusie: Esophageal biopsies show columnar mucosa with intestinal metaplasia and reactive epithelial changes. Contains abnormal glandular mucosa with an unusual serrated pattern, difficult to grade exactly, with high-grade dysplasia not excluded.
